title: Vampire Survivors Is Crossing Over With Among Us To Bring New Weapons And Characters
description:
Poncle has revealed that Vampire Survivors is getting a new DLC called Emergency Meeting, which is a crossover with Innersloth's Among Us. The DLC will launch on December 18 for PC and Xbox, as well as Switch, iOS, and Android at a later date.

There are nine new characters added with the update, including Crewmate Dino, Engineer Gino, Ghost Lino, Guardian Pina, Shapeshifter Nino, Scientist Mina, Imposter Rina, and literally a regular horse. Fifteen new weapons will also be added to the game, such as launching sound waves at enemies with your paper report and dropping them by manifesting a vent.

One new stage is being added, called the Polus Replica, which is a replica of the scientific base on Polus in Among Us. Six new music tracks will be included as well.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Max Reveals First Look At Penguin-Centric The Batman Spin-Off, It Prequel
description:
While we wait for the next big screen chapter of Matt Reeves' take on The Batman, we are finally getting a look at the Penguin-centered spin-off series coming to the Max streaming service.

On Thursday, Max revealed a sizzle reel of their upcoming 2024 shows that had the briefest of glimpses of what fans are in store for with The Penguin, starring Colin Farrell, who is reprising his role from the Reeves film.

"The world ain't built for guys like us," the Penguin says. "You're going to see what I can do!"

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Ark Dev: "The Servers Are Ass, They Run Like Ass, And Their Stability Is Ass"
description:
Studio Wildcard boss Jeremy Stieglitz has made a frank admission about the multiplayer servers for Ark: Survival Ascended, saying they are complete "ass."

During Studio Wildcard's recent Extra Life charity stream, the co-founder of the company said, "The servers are ass. They run like ass. And their stability is ass."

The executive said Survival Ascended's servers will be improved over time "We need to improve it. It's going to be improved," he said, as reported by IGN.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How To Move Villagers Between The Valley And Eternity Isle
description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley's A Rift in Time expansion offers tons of fresh ways to interact with the game on a whole new island known as Eternity Isle. However, you'll likely notice when you arrive that none of your existing villagers' homes have made the move over to the island with you. That doesn't mean they can't, though, so read on for how to move villagers' homes back and forth between the two locations.

How to move villagers between the Valley and Eternity Isle

Moving villagers' homes between the Valley and Eternity Isle isn't a particularly complicated affair, but you'd be forgiven for overlooking it due to the game not explaining how to do so at all.

title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: Where To Find Plastic Scrap
description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley's A Rift in Time expansion adds plenty of never-before-seen fish to catch in its three brand-new biomes, but not everything in the water swims. As a matter of fact, you can reel in some Plastic Scrap for use in various quests and crafting recipes if you know where to fish for it. Here's how to find Plastic Scrap.

How to get Plastic Scrap in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Plastic Scrap is required for a few quests and in a handful of crafting recipes that you'll encounter early in your adventure on Eternity Isle. As such, you'll need to know exactly how to score some as quickly as possible.

title: Destiny 2's The Final Shape Expansion Could Be Bungie's Last Chance To Remain Independent, Report Suggests
description:
Behind the scenes at Destiny 2 developer Bungie, morale is reportedly all-time low following mass layoffs at the company and other cost-cutting measures. In a new IGN report, sources at the studio claim that a "soul-crushing" atmosphere has set in and that the company is at risk of being fully absorbed by Sony.

While Bungie was acquired by Sony for $3.6 billion in 2022, on paper, the company has still been able to operate relatively independently. In the aftermath of the acquisition, its board of directors consists of PlayStation Studios head Herman Hulst, senior Sony VP Eric Lempel, Bungie CTO Luis Villegas, Bungie co-founder Jason Jones, and Bungie CEO Pete Parsons. Essentially, Parsons gets a tie-breaking vote on decisions, but the catch

title: Baldur's Gate 3 Is GameSpot's Game Of The Year 2023
description:
I can point to the exact moment I knew Baldur's Gate 3 would be a banger. Last year, Kurt Indovina wrote, hosted, and produced a video--aptly named The Box That Broke Baldur's Gate 3--in which Swen Vincke spoke in great detail about how Larian Studios utilized everything short of witchcraft to program Baldur's Gate 3 to twist and turn on itself to ensure that, regardless of the choices a player wanted to make, they'd always end up with an artifact in their inventory necessary to progress the game's plot.

In that video, I witnessed the desperation any Game Master has dealt with, the mixture of adaptability and exasperation necessary to plan a rewarding story and simultaneously agonize over contingencies for every chaotic thought the players at your table might have. At that moment, I knew that Larian Studios under

title: Why Baldur's Gate 3 Is GameSpot's Game Of The Year 2023
description: Here's what makes Baldur's Gate 3 our choice for the best game of the year.

title: New Paper Mario-Inspired RPG Born Of Bread Gets Big Launch Discount
description:
The past few months have been filled with high-profile video game launches, but if you're looking for something off the beaten path, Born of Bread is a great option. This Paper Mario-inspired RPG takes place in a 2.5D world that's inhabited by adorable creatures, uses a unique turn-based combat system, and boasts vibrant, eye-catching graphics. The game just launched on December 5, but right now you can snag the PC version at Fanatical for just $18.74 (down from $25).

See deal at Fanatical

That price cut is better than the one offered directly through Steam, yet purchasing through Fanati

title: Pixar's Pandemic Movies Are Finally Coming To Theaters
description:
Pixar's recent streaming hits, including Soul, Turning Red, and Luca, are set for a nationwide theatrical release in 2024. Variety was first to report.

This move comes after each film's exclusive premieres on Disney+ during the peak of the COVID-19 pandemic. Tickets for these screenings go on sale from January 2, with Soul hitting theaters on January 12, followed by Turning Red on February 9, and Luca on March 22. Each film will feature its corresponding short film: Burrow, Kitbull, and For the Birds.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Preorder The Hori USB Playstand To Keep Your Switch Charged While In Tabletop Mode
description:
The Nintendo Switch is an incredibly versatile console, but playing in handheld or tabletop mode often drains its battery faster than you'd expect. And if you want to connect additional accessories while in tabletop mode, you're out of luck--all Switch models are lacking in ports when not docked. However, Hori is hoping to fix both those problems with the Portable USB Playstand for Nintendo Switch, which launches on December 29 and is now up for preorder.

Hori Portable USB

title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Actor Is "Certain" Red Dead 3 Will Happen
description:
Even though Rockstar just released its debut trailer for Grand Theft Auto 6, fans have already started to speculate what the studio might be working on next. Roger Clark, the voice of Arthur Morgan in Red Dead Redemption 2, further ignited the conversation after sharing that he is "certain" that Red Dead 3 will one day be made. However, this doesn't mean fans should expect it anytime soon--or for Clark to be involved in the project.

The news comes from a series of X/Twitter posts by Clark. While the conversation was originally about the fate of GTA Online following GTA 6's announcement, it didn't take long for a f

title: Nicolas Cage Reveals How Many More Movies He Has Left To Make, And It's Not Many
description:
Oscar-winning actor Nicolas Cage has appeared in numerous films over the years, from small-budget independent films to blockbusters. His time as a film actor is seemingly coming to an end, though. Cage told Vanity Fair that he believes he may only have "three or four more movies left in me."

Cage said he feels he's "said what I've had to say with cinema" and doesn't plan to work much more in film. "I think I took film performance as far as I could … I do want to get much more severe and stringent in my selection process … I want to say bye on a high note," he said.

Cage, 59, said he might only have 15 years left to live, but "hopefully more." In any event, Cage said he wants to spend more time with his family at this stage of his career.

title: Barbie Director Says "We'll See" About Ken Movie Spin-Off
description:
The Kenergy might be building for a Barbie spin-off starring Ryan Gosling's Ken. While a lot of focus has been on a potential sequel with Margot Robbie, director Greta Gerwig has seemingly teased a possibly unexpected followup to the biggest movie of the year.

Speaking with 60 Minutes on CBS, Gerwig and her husband Noah Baumbach--who co-wrote Barbie with her--chatted about all of their ideas for Ken that just couldn't make it into the final film. "We had way too much material for Ken," Gerwig said. "We would write, and write, and write."

This led to Gerwig being asked about a Ken spin-off movie. The director laughed, before adding: "I mean, the truth is, you know... I guess we'll see."

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: CoD: Warzone And MW3 Season 1 Patch Notes Detail Weapon Balancing, New Maps, And QoL Changes
description:
Season 1 of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone arrives today, bringing a fresh battle pass to level up, more DLC weapons to unlock, and a new battle royale map. Activision has revealed the full patch notes for the big update, which includes weapon balancing, quality of life updates, and more.

The Season 1 update brings brand-new maps to multiplayer, the return of Call of Duty's 2v2 Gunfight mode, and Zombies has a new story mission. Warzone replaces Al Mazrah with the new Urzikstan map. The map features a 100-player count, and the matches should average around 20 minutes.

As always, the seasonal battle pass has free and paid tiers of the pass. Three guns and two

title: Mortal Kombat 1 Story Expansion Confirmed, Followed By A "Big Surprise" In The Future
description:
Mortal Kombat 1 fans can expect more story content in the future for the game, as creative director Ed Boon has confirmed new DLC is on the way for the fighting game. Similar to Mortal Kombat 11's Aftermath expansion, Boon said that this DLC will add more the game's narrative and will be followed by a "big surprise" afterward.

"Just like we did with Mortal Kombat 11, we're going to release a second part with more story and we have a big surprise after that," Boon said at the CCXP23 event in Brazil (via IGN).

Mortal Kombat 11's Aftermath was a substantial expansion for the game, full of new characters, arenas, and a campaign that had long-lasting ramifications for the franchise. While the next chapter in the New Era timeline of Mortal Kombat 1 is currently locked up tighter than Queen Sindel's miracle haircare products, several fascinating threads could be explored in

title: Natalie Portman Recalls King Charles Asking If She Was In The Original Star Wars Movies
description:
Natalie Portman has recalled meeting Prince Charles in 1999 when she was 18, and how the member of the British royal family--who is now king--asked if she was in the original Star Wars movies.

"I was like, 'No, I'm 18!' But he was very friendly," Portman said on Watch What Happens Live, as reported by Variety.

Portman was born in 1981, which was four years after the original Star Wars movie debuted in 1977. She was cast by George Lucas as Padme Amidala for the prequel series that premiered in 1999 and spawned multiple sequels in the early 2000s.

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Cillian Murphy Gives Update On Peaky Blinders Movie
description:
Cillian Murphy has had the year of his career with Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer--the sixth time they've collaborated--and finds himself as a strong contender for any number of acting awards during the upcoming awards season. Outside of his movie work, though, he's also starred for the last decade on the TV series Peaky Blinders--a show that he recently discovered Barbie star Margot Robbie is a huge fan of.

During Vanity Fair's Actors on Actors, Murphy and Robbie interviewed each other and talked about the "Barbieheimer" phenomenon from this past summer. The two talked about marketing the films, preparing for the roles, and if Murphy was familiar with the internet culture surrounding the very memeable movies. Then Robbie talked about Peaky Blinders, which has been turned into a few games--including a

title: Apex Legends Uprising Event - Loba Prestige Skin, Play-To-Win Ability Buffs, And Tips For Surviving The New 30v30 LTM
description:
Apex Legends Uprising Collection Event


The new Revenant Uprising LTM pits 30 legends against a team of 29 Revenants and one heavily armed Red-Eyed Revenant.

The last episode of Kill Code--Apex Legends' animated YouTube miniseries--may have already aired, but the story isn't over yet. This week, Respawn launched the new Uprising Collection Event, and like all of Apex's Collection Events, Uprising features a new set of 24 premium cosmetics that, once purchased, will unlock a trio of Mythic-tier items (Loba's Apex Lycanthrope Prestige Skin Set, in this case). But unlike previous Collection Events, Uprising also features a massive new 30v30 limited-ti

title: Get Midnight Fight Club, The Gunk, And 6 More Games For $12
description:
Humble Choice subscribers can look forward to some great new games in December, ranging from B-movie action to intergalactic mop-ups. Like previous months, you'll get eight PC games to claim, and all of them will be made available as codes that can be redeemed on Steam.

Humble Choice Collection December 2023

Join Humble Choice
  • Expeditions: Rome
  • Midnight Fight Club
  • The Gunk
  • Elex 2
  • Nobody Saves the World
  • The Pale Beyond
  • Last Call BBS
  • From Space

Kicking off the December lineup is Expeditions: Rome, a tactical turn-based game where you forge your legend as a Legatus commander across ancient battlefields. From Greece to Gaul, it'll be up to you to bring the glory of Rome to foreign coasts, either

title: Review Roundup For Avatar: Frontiers Of Pandora
description:
Almost a year after The Way of Water premiered, Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora brings audiences back to the strange alien world created by James Cameron--but this time in a video game. Ubisoft and developer Massive are behind the open-world title, meaning the similarities to Far Cry are there and mentioned by reviewers.

On GameSpot sister site Metacritic, Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora has a metascore of 74, fitting in the mixed or average range. That's taking into account 52 reviews at the time of publication.

Now, one large difference between Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora and Far Cry is the fact that this game puts players into the role of a 10-foot blue Na'vi. GameSpot's Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora review notes how this serves as a strength for the

title: GTA 6 Trailer Helps Tom Petty Song Surge 37,000% On Spotify
description:
Grand Theft Auto 6's announcement trailer used the 1989 Tom Petty song "Love Is A Long Road," and that song has, unsurprisingly, seen a massive uptick in streams on Spotify this week.

According to IGN, Spotify said streams of the tune on its platform rose by 36,979% compared to this time last week. This is to say nothing of the growth in streams across all the other music services, in addition to anyone who might have bought the song or the album outright.

Petty died in 2017. His estate said on social media that it was an "honor" to have Rockstar use "Love Is A Long Road" in the GTA 6 trailer. This wasn't the first Petty song used in a GTA game, as Petty's "Running' Down A Dream" was

title: Ryan Reynolds Reacts To Deadpool 3 Leaks: "Surprises Are Part Of The Magic"
description:
Deadool 3 is back in production now that the Hollywood strikes have ended, so naturally, images from the set have leaked again on social media. Ryan Reynolds, who stars as Deadpool and is a producer on the film, has released a statement regarding the leaks. He said the leaks are happening because the team chose to film the movie outdoors in real environments as opposed to on a studio lot behind closed doors. Reynolds lamented how some of the movie's surprises might have been spoiled due to the leaks, but he also recognized this is not a "real world" issue.

"Surprises are part of the magic of theatrical movies. It's important for us to shoot the new Deadpool film in real, natural environments, using practical effects, as opposed to making the movie indoors and digitally," Reynolds said on Instagram. "Telephoto lenses continue to spoil surprises and create a difficult situation for everyone. Here's hoping some of t

description:

description:

description:
The Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader Classified Information is but one side quest. However, it's also got overarching objectives, including visits to a couple of planets and discoveries made later in the game. Our guide discusses how to complete Classified Information in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader.

description:
The Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader Footfall Docks Puzzle will have you exploring various areas on a planet. The goal is to find out the correct number sequence based on the clues that you'll discover. Our guide discusses how to solve the Footfall Docks Puzzle in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader.

description:
The Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader Footfall Hidden Caches objective can be downright confusing. It's not just because of the riddles that you need to solve, but also because there's an area that's inaccessible early on. Our guide discusses where to find all Footfall Hidden Caches in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader so you can complete the Dreams and Stories quest.

title: Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader - How To Get More Mobile Extractiums
description:
The Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader Mobile Extractium is perhaps one of the most important items in the game. As the name implies, it's used to collect various resources, which can then be used to complete projects and contracts. However, you'll only find a few of these devices early on, which means you shouldn't waste them. Our guide discusses how to get more Mobile Extractiums in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader.

title: Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader - How To Recruit All Companions
description:
Your Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader companions aren't just there for flavor and fluff. They're your most vaunted allies, aiding you in your quest to vanquish the enemies of the Imperium--technically, some of them are part of that xenos bunch, too. Sanctioned to conduct operations and engage in trade with even the most questionable of personages in the galaxy, it's up to you to lead a capable force like no other. Here's our guide on how to recruit all companions in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader.

Note that are 10 recruitable companions in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader. You can have all of them in your group by the time you reach the game's fourth act. A few do need a bit more convincing than usual. Thankfully, the steps aren't as convoluted

title: Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader - How To Respec And Reset Skills
description:
The Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader respec mechanic allows you to fine-tune your character's build in case you made mistakes or want to try something different. Since the game has several available classes/archetypes, dozens of skills, and hundreds of talents to choose from, it's a given that you'll have to make a few changes down the line. Our guide discusses how to reset your talents and respec in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader. Likewise, please be reminded that this article contains minor spoilers.

description:
The Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader companion romance feature allows you to cozy up with a few party members. You'll get to know more about their past, though be forewarned that you need to make the right decisions. Our guide discusses how to romance companions in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader in case you want a more lovey-dovey experience in the game's grimdark setting.

description:
Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader Medkits are found everywhere, so much so that you'll likely have a lot that you can use just to keep your party in tip-top condition. There's just one problem: the game doesn't really make it clear how you can equip them in the first place. Our guide discusses how to equip and use Medkits in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader.

description:
The Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader Navis Nobilite Lab Puzzle on Eurac V is the first brain teaser you'll encounter in the campaign. It's also heavily reliant on the clues that you read while exploring the mini-dungeon. Our guide discusses how to solve the Eurac V Navis Nobilite Lab puzzle in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader so you can obtain one of two potential rewards.

description:
The Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader faction reputation system can be quite a doozy at first glance. That's because it's unlike most other mechanics seen in traditional role-playing games. Thankfully, we've got a few tips to help you make sense of the whole thing. Our guide discusses how trading and faction reputation works in Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader.

title: Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader Guides Hub
description:
Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader is the newest computer role-playing game from Owlcat Games, the studio behind Pathfinder: Kingmaker and Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous. Set in a grimdark universe, your character must lead a band of misfits who hate each other so you can discover what truly happened to your predecessor. Along the way, you'll face xenos and heretics that threaten the stability of the Koronus Expanse. Our Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader guides hub has everything you need for a journey that can take you over a hundred hours to complete.

Table of Contents [hide]
  • Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader guides hub
    • Character creation and basics

title: Avatar: Frontiers Of Pandora Review - The Good Blue Man Group
description:
Before starting Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, I was reminded of what I think of when considering any open-world game: Killscreen's review of Fallout 4 by Chris Breault, and the opening line, "Here comes the trashman!" Breault discusses an experience of constantly picking up and covering yourself in the garbage scattered around that game's massive world. It's a description that feels highly applicable to most open-world games--huge, but full of refuse that you spend endless hours picking through and carting around, only to replace it with newer, better garbage. Most open-world games are too concerned with filling their worlds, both literally and metaphorically, with a deluge of needless stuff, and it’s why I find the genre can be off-putting.

It's the fear of that torrent of trash that mad

title: Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora Review
description: Though it includes a lot of familiar open-world elements, a minimalistic user interface, fun movement mechanics, and a gorgeous setting make it a blast to explore Pandora.

title: Rockstar Devs Express Disappointment With GTA 6 Trailer Leak
description:
Grand Theft Auto 6's much anticipated first trailer was leaked just ahead of its scheduled release date, and the devs who worked on it have reacted with anger and disappointment across social media--most expressing that it had ruined a moment many Rockstar devs had been looking forward to.

Not long before it was meant to debut, the GTA 6 trailer was leaked on social media, the experience further marred by a crypto-related watermark slapped across the footage. The leaker's account was quickly taken down, and Rockstar pushed up its official release with the statement: "Our trailer has leaked so please watch the real thing on YouTube."

A number of developers reacted on social media, as picked up by IGN, though a few of th

title: Diablo 4's Endgame Pinnacle Dungeon Abattoir Of Zir Arrives In Latest Patch
description:
Diablo 4's new endgame event, Abattoir of Zir, is live now in game, daring players to take on the brutal dungeon in order to unlock and upgrade the powerful Tears of Blood Glyph. The first level of the Abattoir of Zir is around the same difficulty as a level 100 Nightmare Dungeon, and each of its 25 levels only get more difficult from there.

The Abattoir of Zir requires players to have completed all of the chapters of the Season of Blood, after which they'll unlock a recipe for the Bloodforged Sigil, which grants access to the new dungeon. In the Abattoir, players will have just 10 minutes to kill enough enemies to summon the dungeon bosses, which then have to be defeated to clear the level.

Each tier successfully cleared will unlock the recipe for the next tier's Bloodforg

title: Windows 10 To Offer Paid Security Updates
description:
Windows 10 users will have the option to sign up for paid security updates after Microsoft ends its official support for the system on October 14, 2025, the company has revealed in a new blog post, as picked up by The Verge.

The program is called Extended Security update or ESU, and will be extended to all Windows 10 users who wish to keep using the OS once it reaches the end of its official support. While Microsoft has previously offered a similar option to organizations who needed to continue with an older OS, Windows 10 will also have an ESU program for individuals.

Extended support will be offered in the form of critical and important security updates, and will be available as a yearly paid subscription

title: Baldur's Gate 3 Players Have Been Turned Into A Wheel Of Cheese Over 1.2 Million Times
description:
Larian Studios has released a fresh lot of stats on how players are engaging with its hit RPG Baldur's Gate 3, with the game having been out now for over four months. The developer has given an update on the game's most popular romances, classes, and races, as well as revealing that a staggering number of players have been turned into a sentient cheese wheel.

To be specific, 1.24 million players have been turned into a cheese wheel by a djinni trained in cheesemancy--check out our guide here if you want to know exactly how this can happen. The number is shockingly close to the number of players who have actually finished the game, which sits at 1.3 million.

⚔️ Since our launch in August, over 1.3 million players have completed Baldur's Gate

title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: Cave Of Wonders Puzzles Guide
description:
If you're following the main story quests in Disney Dreamlight Valley's A Rift in Time expansion, you'll eventually come across the Cave of Wonders. When entering, you'll find that there are multiple mirror puzzles inside that need to be solved to open the doors leading to the Jewel of Time. Here's how to make it to the end of the Cave of Wonder.

How to solve the Cave of Wonder puzzles in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Inside the first room of the Cave of Wonders, take a left and clear the Splinters of Fate in your way, then pick up the Pow
